title: What would be the practical speed of 5G if implemented? - Quora

response.answer_text: Practical speed of 5G is yet to be determined as theortically speaking it would provide over 1GBPS and showed similar results in test environment. However, this kind of speed wouldn’t be needed (more than enough and would disrupt technology and security standards) and so this would strictly be used for services like M2M communication, contactless payments, driverless commute etc. In entertainment industry however, it would be useful for online gaming, AR/VR implementation etc.

When implemented in the near future, 5G will support data rates from 20–100 Mbps for mobile nodes. Adaptive modulation techniques (or higher order modulation techniques) enable the efficient utilisation of the available bandwidth. Data rates needn't be necessarily increased only by increasing the bandwidth. Nowadays, bidding of bandwidth is costly with the competition between various telcos. The expected bandwidth for 5G system is 100 MHz or more than that. MIMO systems exploit spatial multiplexing to enhance the data rates because a single antenna can't yield a higher bandwidth. The frequency of operation is in the 2–8 GHz band.

5G stands for the fifth generation of wireless technologies and it will be faster than 4G. That is a no-brainer but how much faster is the question. The details are a bit sketchy at this point but the speeds are supposed to be upwards of 1 to 20Gbps compare to the 4G standards which are 100Mbps up to 1Gbps. Yeah a lot faster. But will those speeds ever be realized is another question that we will find out sometime around the year 2020.

You can expect practical speeds to be 1/10th of the theoretical ones. So given that the nominal speeds for a 5G network as 1Gbps, you can expect to receive at least 100Mbps. Speed is not everything. There are other factors like latency etc should also improve with 5G if implemented.

5G will provide the most efficient uploading and downloading speed. The internet speed of the 5G will be more efficient than existing LTE networks. It will have a minimum speed of 50mbps and up and a maximum speed of 1-10gbps. Currently, IoT technologies using the 4G network are not able to process data quickly but with 5G which is 10X faster than 4G will be able to transfer data faster. Also, 5G has better connectivity than 4G which means more devices can be connected at the same time. Other features of 5G like zero latency, improved bandwidth and reduction in battery consumption due to data makes it perfect for IoT. Reliance Jio is working towards bringing 5G technology to the market which will enhance IoT technologies. It shall bring 5G technology to its users very soon and work is already underway to improve its infrastructure and all these will soon be available to users.

Speed of 5G will definitely be better as compared to 4 G and may range to a few Gigs per sec. But there are some external factors which will make the variations in speed such as the modulation technique used and the encoders employed. However, this will definitely require switching to more costly devices.

Note that they are many revisions which will be made to the 5G architecture to improve the efficiency but as of now these are the figures Peak data rate - 20 Gbit/s User experienced data rate - 1 Gbit/s Latency - 1 ms Mobility - 500 km/h

While Verizon hasn't specified how fast its 5G network speeds will be, an early test witnessed by CNET showcased whopping speeds of 3.77Gbps. That's faster than Google Fiber, which delivers internet speeds of up to 1Gbps.
Theoretically it will be 1 Gbps and above. Practical speed can not be judged till launch of some commercial launches.
May be it will 500 mb or above
